title: Dawn of a new era: America enters the 20th century
creator_credit: SL Film Productions and Gerald A Schiller
brief_description: Looks at the United States at the turn of the century, from McKinley’s inauguration to the early days of Theodore Roosevelt’s presidency. It was the world’s largest industrial nation and employed on million children aged between ten and fifteen years earning $3.50 per week. Also shows New York at that time. Suitable for upper secondary level.
